Interaction Between Requesters and a Large Mechanized retrieval System .A Lancaster, F.W. In a large mechanized retrieval system, a certain proportion of the search failures are likely to be directly attributable to inadequate user-system interaction.. Request statements may be only distant  approximations of actual information requirements.. This paper discusses some of the problems of the user-system interface and suggests methods whereby these problems may be alleviated.. .X 29	2	451 58	3	451 66	1	451 124	1	451 127	1	451 129	1	451 165	1	451 190	1	451 191	1	451 197	1	451 211	1	451 214	1	451 218	1	451 243	1	451 274	1	451 307	1	451 330	1	451 378	1	451 445	1	451 450	1	451 451	5	451 452	1	451 459	1	451 460	1	451 468	1	451 484	1	451 492	1	451 508	1	451 511	1	451 512	1	451 514	1	451 518	1	451 520	1	451 523	1	451 524	1	451 525	1	451 526	2	451 529	1	451 530	1	451 534	1	451 546	2	451 553	1	451 579	1	451 590	1	451 594	1	451 603	1	451 604	1	451 606	2	451 609	3	451 610	1	451 611	1	451 612	2	451 625	1	451 626	1	451 630	1	451 636	1	451 637	2	451 641	1	451 642	2	451 648	1	451 650	1	451 656	1	451 689	1	451 692	1	451 696	1	451 699	1	451 703	1	451 705	1	451 708	1	451 726	1	451 727	1	451 728	1	451 731	1	451 732	1	451 733	2	451 734	1	451 736	1	451 738	1	451 739	1	451 740	1	451 741	1	451 742	1	451 743	1	451 744	1	451 755	1	451 762	1	451 785	1	451 814	1	451 820	1	451 826	1	451 827	1	451 879	1	451 883	1	451 901	1	451 967	1	451 1004	1	451 1035	1	451 1054	1	451 1077	1	451 1078	1	451 1089	1	451 1091	1	451 1094	1	451 1207	1	451 1231	1	451 1264	1	451 1297	1	451 1303	1	451 1356	1	451 1364	1	451 1368	1	451 1370	1	451 1372	1	451 1373	1	451 1374	1	451 1375	1	451 1376	1	451 1377	2	451 1377	2	451
